usdl.servicemodel

Class LinkedUSDLModelFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • usdl.servicemodel.LinkedUSDLModelFactory

  • public class LinkedUSDLModelFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    The LinkedUSDLModelFactory class is a factory for initializing a LinkedUSDLModel instance.
    Version:
    1.0, March 12
    Author:
    Daniel Barrigas, Jorge Araujo

      • createEmptyModel

        public static LinkedUSDLModel createEmptyModel()
        Creates an empty LinkedUSDLModel instance.
        Returns:
        An initialized LinkedUSDLModel object.

      • createEmptyModel

        public static LinkedUSDLModel createEmptyModel(java.lang.String baseURI)
        Creates an empty LinkedUSDLModel instance with a user defined baseURI.
        Parameters:
        baseURI - the base URI to use in the model
        Returns:
        An initialized LinkedUSDLModel object.

      • createFromModel

        public static LinkedUSDLModel createFromModel(java.lang.String path)
                                       throws InvalidLinkedUSDLModelException,
                                              java.io.IOException,
                                              ReadModelException
        Creates a LinkedUSDLModel instance based on an already existing Linked USDL model. The existing model is read from the file path that can either be to a single file (TTL or RDF) or to a folder containing any number of these file types. Note that all files with file extensions: ttl and rdf will be imported and validated for Linked USDL compliance.
        Parameters:
        path - The file path from where to import the Linked USDL model
        Returns:
        An initialized LinkedUSDLModel object already populated with all elements read.
        Throws:
        InvalidLinkedUSDLModelException
        java.io.IOException
        ReadModelException

      • createFromModel

        public static LinkedUSDLModel createFromModel(java.lang.String path,
                              boolean validation)
                                       throws InvalidLinkedUSDLModelException,
                                              java.io.IOException,
                                              ReadModelException
        Creates a LinkedUSDLModel instance based on an already existing Linked USDL model. The existing model is read from the file path that can either be to a single file (TTL or RDF) or to a folder containing any number of these file types. Note that all files with file extensions: ttl and rdf will be imported. The imported model validation or not depends on the parameter validation.
        Parameters:
        path - The file path from where to import the Linked USDL model
        validation - enable/disable linked USDL model validation
        Returns:
        An initialized LinkedUSDLModel object already populated with all elements read.
        Throws:
        InvalidLinkedUSDLModelException
        java.io.IOException
        ReadModelException

      • createFromModel

        public static LinkedUSDLModel createFromModel(java.lang.String path,
                              java.lang.String baseURI,
                              boolean validation)
                                       throws InvalidLinkedUSDLModelException,
                                              java.io.IOException,
                                              ReadModelException
        Creates a LinkedUSDLModel instance based on an already existing Linked USDL model. The existing model is read from the file path that can either be to a single file (TTL or RDF) or to a folder containing any number of these file types. Note that all files with file extensions: ttl and rdf will be imported and validated as a whole for Linked USDL compliance.
        Parameters:
        path - The file path from where to import the Linked USDL model
        baseURI - the base URI to use in the model
        validation - enable/disable linked USDL model validation
        Returns:
        An initialized LinkedUSDLModel object already populated with all elements read.
        Throws:
        InvalidLinkedUSDLModelException
        java.io.IOException
        ReadModelException
